meanings.definition: Informal term for benefits or advantages.
meanings.sent1: The company offers great bennies like free snacks.
meanings.sent2: She considered the health insurance one of the best bennies of the job.
meanings.sent3: Getting extra vacation days was a real bennies boost.
meanings.sent4: The bennies of hard work are often seen in promotions and raises.
meanings.sent5: Having a supportive team is one of the key bennies in this workplace.

meanings.sent1: The Bennies were excited to meet their favorite singer.
meanings.sent2: At the family reunion, all the cousins gathered around the Bennies.
meanings.sent3: When the Bennies arrived, the party really started.
meanings.sent4: The Bennies always brought joy wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: Everyone loved the Bennies for their kindness and humor.
